info.headline: Air Stagnation Advisory issued January 01 at 11:41PM MST until January 03 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Boise
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST TUESDAY... ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. For the Air Stagnation Advisory, an extended period of stagnant air, with light winds and little vertical mixing. * WHERE...For the Dense Fog Advisory, in the Upper Treasure Valley west and north of Mountain Home. For the Air Stagnation Advisory, the entire Upper Treasure valley. * WHEN...For the Air Stagnation Advisory, until 8 AM MST /7 AM PST/ Wednesday. For the Dense Fog Advisory, from 8 PM MST /7 PM PST/ this evening to 11 AM MST /10 AM PST/ Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. Additional hazard due to patchy black ice in the foggy areas. Periods of air stagnation can lead to the buildup of pollutants near the surface.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. An Air Stagnation Advisory concerns itself with meteorological conditions only. For more information on air pollution in Idaho visit website www.deq.idaho.gov. If possible, reduce or eliminate activities that contribute to air pollution, such as outdoor burning, and the use of residential wood burning devices. Reduce vehicle trips and vehicle idling as much as possible.
